byline.contributor: Austin Huguelet reported from Jefferson City, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York.
byline.original: By AUSTIN HUGUELET and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Missouri Republicans employ rarely-used move to break Democratic filibuster of bill that would shield religious groups and businesses from having to facilitate same-sex weddings; bill, part of broader, nationwide debate over issue, has been condemned by some as discriminatory, while proponents say it protects religious freedoms.
lead_paragraph: Republicans broke a filibuster by Democrats, passing a bill that would shield religious groups and businesses from having to facilitate same-sex weddings.

headline.main: Missouri Senate Approves Bill Protecting Foes of Gay Marriage

snippet: Republicans broke a filibuster by Democrats, passing a bill that would shield religious groups and businesses from having to facilitate same-sex weddings.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
